data.text: @JusDayDa @MLevitt_NP2013 And the panic driven crowding in super markets and testing centres. The government can actually blame themselves for that.

@MLevitt_NP2013 The other thing to consider is that the government actions have led to panic and people have been crowding into super markets and testing centres in very cold weather by HK standards. I am sure these unusual crowding of ppl has contributed to the rise in cases.

@MLevitt_NP2013 If the cause is accumulation of a frail population in HK then it's strange that the frail in NZ whose imminent demise you wrongly predicted 2 winters running are still clinging on. https://t.co/y4RlQcks4z

@MLevitt_NP2013 @tlowdon Could be you see something similar in Slovenia (yellow) Slovenia had a very strict lockdown in 2020. @orwell2022
https://t.co/9roXFfAUqi

@MLevitt_NP2013 Its not Gompertz
Its people and how people behave
Seasonal holiday mixing of people
anything which drives people indoors
will increase cases
As cases occur in densely populated areas
the case growth increases
Michael, please accept that the spread is not math
Its people.

@MLevitt_NP2013 yeah, probably because it is not a bunch of asynchronous nested outbreaks plotted as one like most everywhere else you plot.
Hint: NZ is defeating your nonsense g🤪mPeRtZ too!
